This manuscript is the first part of a two volume passionaries dating to the second quarter of the twelfth century. The manuscript was bought in Pistoia in 1744, and likely also was connected to the purchase of a giant two-volume bible and a two-volume homilary. What is clear from the hagiographic program is that the work was created with Tuscany, and especially Pistoia, in mind. The connection with Rufinus is argued as “a clear indication that the manuscript was made for Pistoiese use, so is Mustiola of Chiusi, who in Northern Tuscany is only found in Pistoiese works
